intro: Merinthopodium neuranthum, commonly known as the slender false pomegranate, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
